ðŸŒŸ shutter-encoder | Java
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Professional video compression for a wide range of users.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Video compression â€¢ FFmpeg-based â€¢ GUI for ease of use â€¢ Cross-platform (Java)
ðŸ“– Summary: Shutter Encoder is a professional-grade video compression tool built upon FFmpeg, designed to be accessible to all users. It provides a graphical user interface (GUI) for simplifying the video compression process. The application is written in Java.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ OsintTube | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: YouTube OSINT analysis
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Retrieves channel description â€¢ Retrieves channel location â€¢ Retrieves total number of videos â€¢ Retrieves number of subscribers â€¢ Retrieves total channel views
ðŸ“– Summary: OsintTube is a Python-based tool designed for performing Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) analysis on YouTube channels. It provides an interactive shell to extract various data points, including channel description, location, video count, subscriber count, views, estimated video duration, join date, category, and estimated earnings. The tool aims to simplify the process of gathering information from YouTube channels for investigative purposes.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ tldx | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Brainstorming and finding available domain names quickly.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Smart keyword-based domain permutations (prefixes, suffixes, TLDs) â€¢ Fast and concurrent WHOIS availability checks â€¢ Streams results as they're found â€¢ Optional filtering by domain length
ðŸ“– Summary: tldx is a command-line tool designed to help users quickly brainstorm and identify available domain names. It achieves this by generating domain permutations based on keywords, prefixes, suffixes, and TLDs, and then concurrently checking their availability using WHOIS lookups. The tool streams results as they are found and offers options for filtering by domain length.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ pangolin | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Securely expose private resources on distributed networks through a tunneled reverse proxy with identity and access control.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Reverse Proxy Through WireGuard Tunnel â€¢ Identity & Access Management â€¢ Simple Dashboard UI â€¢ Easy Deployment â€¢ Modular Design
ðŸ“– Summary: Pangolin is a self-hosted tunneled reverse proxy server designed to securely expose private resources on distributed networks. It provides features like reverse proxy through WireGuard, identity and access management, a simple dashboard UI, and easy deployment options. Pangolin acts as a central hub, connecting isolated networks through encrypted tunnels, enabling easy access to remote services without opening ports.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ exporter_exporter | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing a single entry point for querying multiple Prometheus exporters, simplifying firewall configurations and enhancing security.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Reverse proxy for Prometheus exporters â€¢ Single port access for multiple exporters â€¢ TLS with client certificate authentication â€¢ Metrics verification â€¢ Script execution for metrics generation
ðŸ“– Summary: The exporter_exporter repository offers a reverse proxy solution tailored for Prometheus exporters. It consolidates access to multiple exporters through a single port, simplifying firewall management and providing TLS encryption. Additionally, it verifies metrics and supports script execution for generating custom metrics, making it a versatile tool for monitoring infrastructure.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ PraisonAI | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating and solving problems ranging from simple tasks to complex challenges using multi-agent LLM systems.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automated AI Agents Creation â€¢ Self Reflection AI Agents â€¢ Reasoning AI Agents â€¢ Multi Modal AI Agents â€¢ Multi Agent Collaboration
ðŸ“– Summary: PraisonAI is a production-ready Multi AI Agents framework designed for building and managing multi-agent LLM systems. It offers a low-code solution that emphasizes simplicity, customization, and effective human-agent collaboration. The framework supports features like automated agent creation, self-reflection, reasoning, multi-modal capabilities, and integration with tools like LangChain.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ cgroup-utils | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing and monitoring Linux control groups for resource management and process isolation.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Provides utility tools for managing Linux control groups (cgroups). â€¢ Offers commands like `cgutil top` for monitoring cgroup activities. â€¢ Includes commands for configuring cgroups (`cgutil configs`), managing events (`cgutil event`), and listing processes within cgroups (`cgutil pgrep`).
ðŸ“– Summary: cgroup-utils provides a suite of command-line tools for interacting with Linux control groups. It enables users to monitor resource usage, configure cgroup settings, manage processes within cgroups, and visualize the cgroup hierarchy. The utilities simplify cgroup management for both system administrators and developers.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ js-lingui | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Internationalizing JavaScript applications for global audiences.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Clean and readable code with ICU MessageFormat â€¢ Universal usage across JavaScript projects, including React and React Native â€¢ Full rich-text support with React components â€¢ Powerful tooling for managing i18n workflow (CLI, Vite Plugin, ESLint Plugin)
ðŸ“– Summary: Lingui is a JavaScript internationalization framework that provides tools and libraries for translating applications. It supports ICU MessageFormat, React components, and offers tooling for managing the i18n workflow. Lingui aims to be lightweight, unopinionated, and compatible with existing i18n solutions.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ whatsapp-web-reveng | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Reverse engineering the WhatsApp Web API to create a custom client.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Complete description and re-implementation of the WhatsApp Web API â€¢ WebSocket communication â€¢ Nix environment support â€¢ JavaScript decryption routine â€¢ Python dependencies for encryption and QR code generation
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides a reverse-engineered implementation of the WhatsApp Web API, focusing on WebSocket communication and encryption. It aims to provide a complete description of the API, enabling the development of custom WhatsApp Web clients. The project includes tools and instructions for setting up the environment using Nix or bare metal installations with Python and Node.js.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ ipspot | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Retrieving the current system's IP address and location information.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Retrieves system's IP address â€¢ Supports public and private IPv4 detection â€¢ Uses multiple API providers with fallback mechanism â€¢ Provides geolocation information
ðŸ“– Summary: IPSpot is a Python library designed for retrieving a system's IP address and associated geolocation data. It supports both public and private IPv4 addresses, utilizing multiple API providers to ensure reliability. The tool offers a simple and modular approach to IP and geolocation lookups.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
